verses.verse: And the LORD<WH3068> spoke<WH559> unto<WH413> Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175> in the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> saying,<WH559>
This <WH2088> month<WH2320> shall be unto you the beginning<WH7218> of months:<WH2320> it<WH1931> shall be the first<WH7223> month<WH2320> of the year<WH8141> to you.

Speak <WH1696> ye unto<WH413> all<WH3605> the congregation<WH5712> of Israel,<WH3478> saying,<WH559> In the tenth<WH6218> day of this<WH2088> month<WH2320> they shall take<WH3947> to them every man<WH376> a lamb,<WH7716> according to the house<WH1004> of their fathers,<WH1> a lamb<WH7716> for a house: <WH1004>

And if<WH518> the household<WH1004> be too little<WH4591> for the lamb,<WH4480> <WH1961> <WH4480> <WH7716> let him<WH1931> and his neighbor<WH7934> next<WH7138> unto<WH413> his house<WH1004> take<WH3947> it according to the number<WH4373> of the souls;<WH5315> every man<WH376> according to<WH6310> his eating<WH400> shall make your count<WH3699> for<WH5921> the lamb.<WH7716>

Your lamb<WH7716> shall be<WH1961> without blemish,<WH8549> a male<WH2145> of the first<WH1121> year:<WH8141> ye shall take it out<WH3947> from<WH4480> the sheep,<WH3532> or from<WH4480> the goats: <WH5795>

And ye shall keep<WH1961> <WH4931> it up until<WH5704> the fourteenth<WH702> <WH6240> day<WH3117> of the same<WH2088> month:<WH2320> and the whole<WH3605> assembly<WH6951> of the congregation<WH5712> of Israel<WH3478> shall kill<WH7819> it in<WH996> the evening.<WH6153>

And they shall take<WH3947> of<WH4480> the blood,<WH1818> and strike<WH5414> it on<WH5921> the two<WH8147> side posts<WH4201> and on<WH5921> the upper door post<WH4947> of<WH5921> the houses,<WH1004> wherein<WH834> they shall eat<WH398> it.

And they shall eat<WH398> <WH853> the flesh<WH1320> in that<WH2088> night,<WH3915> roast<WH6748> with fire,<WH784> and unleavened bread;<WH4682> and with<WH5921> bitter<WH4844> herbs they shall eat<WH398> it.

Eat <WH398> not<WH408> of<WH4480> it raw,<WH4995> nor sodden at all<WH1311> <WH1310> with water,<WH4325> but<WH3588> <WH518> roast<WH6748> with fire;<WH784> his head<WH7218> with<WH5921> his legs,<WH3767> and with<WH5921> the purtenance<WH7130> thereof.

And ye shall let nothing<WH3808> of<WH4480> it remain<WH3498> until<WH5704> the morning;<WH1242> and that which remaineth<WH3498> of<WH4480> it until<WH5704> the morning<WH1242> ye shall burn<WH8313> with fire.<WH784>

And thus<WH3602> shall ye eat<WH398> it; with your loins<WH4975> girded,<WH2296> your shoes<WH5275> on your feet,<WH7272> and your staff<WH4731> in your hand;<WH3027> and ye shall eat<WH398> it in haste:<WH2649> it<WH1931> is the LORD's<WH3068> passover.<WH6453>

For I will pass through<WH5674> the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> this<WH2088> night,<WH3915> and will smite<WH5221> all<WH3605> the firstborn<WH1060> in the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> both man<WH4480> <WH120> and beast;<WH929> and against all<WH3605> the gods<WH430> of Egypt<WH4714> I will execute<WH6213> judgment:<WH8201> I<WH589> am the LORD.<WH3068>

And the blood<WH1818> shall be<WH1961> to you for a token<WH226> upon<WH5921> the houses<WH1004> where<WH834> ye<WH859> are: and when I see<WH7200> <WH853> the blood,<WH1818> I will pass<WH6452> over<WH5921> you, and the plague<WH5063> shall not<WH3808> be<WH1961> upon you to destroy<WH4889> you, when I smite<WH5221> the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>

And this<WH2088> day<WH3117> shall be<WH1961> unto you for a memorial;<WH2146> and ye shall keep<WH2287> it a feast<WH2282> to the LORD<WH3068> throughout your generations;<WH1755> ye shall keep it a feast<WH2287> by an ordinance<WH2708> forever.<WH5769>

Seven <WH7651> days<WH3117> shall ye eat<WH398> unleavened bread;<WH4682> even<WH389> the first<WH7223> day<WH3117> ye shall put away<WH7673> leaven<WH7603> out of your houses:<WH4480> <WH1004> for<WH3588> whosoever<WH3605> eateth<WH398> leavened bread<WH2557> from the first day<WH4480> <WH7223> <WH3117> until<WH5704> the seventh<WH7637> day,<WH3117> that<WH1931> soul<WH5315> shall be cut off<WH3772> from Israel.<WH4480> <WH3478>

And in the first<WH7223> day<WH3117> there shall be a holy<WH6944> convocation,<WH4744> and in the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117> there shall be<WH1961> a holy<WH6944> convocation<WH4744> to you; no<WH3808> manner<WH3605> of work<WH4399> shall be done<WH6213> in them, save<WH389> that which<WH834> every<WH3605> man<WH5315> must eat,<WH398> that<WH1931> only<WH905> may be done<WH6213> of you.

And ye shall observe<WH8104> <WH853> the feast of unleavened bread;<WH4682> for<WH3588> in this<WH2088> selfsame<WH6106> day<WH3117> have I brought your armies out<WH3318> <WH853> <WH6635> of the land<WH4480> <WH776> of Egypt:<WH4714> therefore shall ye observe<WH8104> <WH853> this<WH2088> day<WH3117> in your generations<WH1755> by an ordinance<WH2708> forever.<WH5769>

In the first<WH7223> month, on the fourteenth<WH702> <WH6240> day<WH3117> of the month<WH2320> at even,<WH6153> ye shall eat<WH398> unleavened bread,<WH4682> until<WH5704> the one<WH259> and twentieth<WH6242> day<WH3117> of the month<WH2320> at even.<WH6153>

Seven <WH7651> days<WH3117> shall there be no<WH3808> leaven<WH7603> found<WH4672> in your houses:<WH1004> for<WH3588> whosoever<WH3605> eateth<WH398> that which is leavened,<WH2557> even that<WH1931> soul<WH5315> shall be cut off<WH3772> from the congregation<WH4480> <WH5712> of Israel,<WH3478> whether he be a stranger,<WH1616> or born<WH249> in the land.<WH776>
Ye shall eat<WH398> nothing<WH3605> <WH3808> leavened;<WH2557> in all<WH3605> your habitations<WH4186> shall ye eat<WH398> unleavened bread.<WH4682>

Then Moses<WH4872> called<WH7121> for all<WH3605> the elders<WH2205> of Israel,<WH3478> and said<WH559> unto<WH413> them, Draw out<WH4900> and take<WH3947> you a lamb<WH6629> according to your families,<WH4940> and kill<WH7819> the passover.<WH6453>

And ye shall take<WH3947> a bunch<WH92> of hyssop,<WH231> and dip<WH2881> it in the blood<WH1818> that<WH834> is in the basin,<WH5592> and strike<WH5060> <WH413> the lintel<WH4947> and the two<WH8147> side posts<WH4201> with<WH4480> the blood<WH1818> that<WH834> is in the basin;<WH5592> and none<WH3808> <WH376> of you<WH859> shall go out<WH3318> at the door<WH4480> <WH6607> of his house<WH1004> until<WH5704> the morning.<WH1242>

For the LORD<WH3068> will pass through<WH5674> to smite<WH5062> <WH853> the Egyptians;<WH4714> and when he seeth<WH7200> <WH853> the blood<WH1818> upon<WH5921> the lintel,<WH4947> and on<WH5921> the two<WH8147> side posts,<WH4201> the LORD<WH3068> will pass<WH6452> over<WH5921> the door,<WH6607> and will not<WH3808> suffer<WH5414> the destroyer<WH7843> to come in<WH935> unto<WH413> your houses<WH1004> to smite<WH5062> you.
And ye shall observe<WH8104> <WH853> this<WH2088> thing<WH1697> for an ordinance<WH2706> to thee and to thy sons<WH1121> forever.<WH5704> <WH5769>

And it shall come to pass,<WH1961> when<WH3588> ye be come<WH935> to<WH413> the land<WH776> which<WH834> the LORD<WH3068> will give<WH5414> you, according as<WH834> he hath promised,<WH1696> that ye shall keep<WH8104> <WH853> this<WH2063> service.<WH5656>
And it shall come to pass,<WH1961> when<WH3588> your children<WH1121> shall say<WH559> unto<WH413> you, What<WH4100> mean ye by this<WH2063> service?<WH5656>

That ye shall say,<WH559> It<WH1931> is the sacrifice<WH2077> of the LORD's<WH3068> passover,<WH6453> who<WH834> passed<WH6452> over<WH5921> the houses<WH1004> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> in Egypt,<WH4714> when he smote<WH5062> <WH853> the Egyptians,<WH4714> and delivered<WH5337> our houses.<WH1004> And the people<WH5971> bowed the head<WH6915> and worshiped.<WH7812>
And the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> went away,<WH1980> and did<WH6213> as<WH834> the LORD<WH3068> had commanded<WH6680> <WH853> Moses<WH4872> and Aaron,<WH175> so<WH3651> did<WH6213> they.

And it came to pass,<WH1961> that at midnight<WH2677> <WH3915> the LORD<WH3068> smote<WH5221> all<WH3605> the firstborn<WH1060> in the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> from the firstborn<WH4480> <WH1060> of Pharaoh<WH6547> that sat<WH3427> on<WH5921> his throne<WH3678> unto<WH5704> the firstborn<WH1060> of the captive<WH7628> that<WH834> was in the dungeon;<WH1004> <WH953> and all<WH3605> the firstborn<WH1060> of cattle.<WH929>

And Pharaoh<WH6547> rose up<WH6965> in the night,<WH3915> he,<WH1931> and all<WH3605> his servants,<WH5650> and all<WH3605> the Egyptians;<WH4714> and there was<WH1961> a great<WH1419> cry<WH6818> in Egypt;<WH4714> for<WH3588> there was not<WH369> a house<WH1004> where<WH834> <WH8033> there was not<WH369> one dead.<WH4191>

And he called<WH7121> for Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175> by night,<WH3915> and said,<WH559> Rise up,<WH6965> and get you forth<WH3318> from among<WH4480> <WH8432> my people,<WH5971> both<WH1571> ye<WH859> and<WH1571> the children<WH1121> of Israel;<WH3478> and go,<WH1980> serve<WH5647> <WH853> the LORD,<WH3068> as ye have said.<WH1696>
Also <WH1571> take<WH3947> your flocks<WH6629> and<WH1571> your herds,<WH1241> as<WH834> ye have said,<WH1696> and be gone;<WH1980> and bless<WH1288> me also.<WH1571>

And the Egyptians<WH4714> were urgent<WH2388> upon<WH5921> the people,<WH5971> that they might send them out<WH7971> of<WH4480> the land<WH776> in haste;<WH4116> for<WH3588> they said,<WH559> We be all<WH3605> dead<WH4191> men.

And the people<WH5971> took<WH5375> <WH853> their dough<WH1217> before<WH2962> it was leavened,<WH2556> their kneading troughs<WH4863> being bound up<WH6887> in their clothes<WH8071> upon<WH5921> their shoulders.<WH7926>

And the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> did<WH6213> according to the word<WH1697> of Moses;<WH4872> and they borrowed<WH7592> of the Egyptians<WH4480> <WH4714> jewels<WH3627> of silver,<WH3701> and jewels<WH3627> of gold,<WH2091> and raiment: <WH8071>

And the LORD<WH3068> gave<WH5414> the people<WH5971> <WH853> favor<WH2580> in the sight<WH5869> of the Egyptians,<WH4714> so that they lent<WH7592> unto them such things as they required. And they spoiled<WH5337> <WH853> the Egyptians.<WH4714>

And the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> journeyed<WH5265> from Rameses<WH4480> <WH7486> to Succoth,<WH5523> about six<WH8337> hundred<WH3967> thousand<WH505> on foot<WH7273> that were men,<WH1397> beside<WH905> children.<WH4480> <WH2945>
And a mixed<WH6154> multitude<WH7227> went up<WH5927> also<WH1571> with<WH854> them; and flocks,<WH6629> and herds,<WH1241> even very<WH3966> much<WH3515> cattle.<WH4735>

And they baked<WH644> unleavened<WH4682> cakes<WH5692> of<WH853> the dough<WH1217> which<WH834> they brought forth<WH3318> out of Egypt,<WH4480> <WH4714> for<WH3588> it was not leavened;<WH3808> <WH2556> because<WH3588> they were thrust out<WH1644> of Egypt,<WH4480> <WH4714> and could<WH3201> not<WH3808> tarry,<WH4102> neither<WH1571> <WH3808> had they prepared<WH6213> for themselves any victual.<WH6720>
Now the sojourning<WH4186> of the children<WH1121> of Israel,<WH3478> who<WH834> dwelt<WH3427> in Egypt,<WH4714> was four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> and thirty<WH7970> years.<WH8141>

And it came to pass<WH1961> at the end<WH4480> <WH7093> of the four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> and thirty<WH7970> years,<WH8141> even the selfsame<WH2088> <WH6106> day<WH3117> it came to pass,<WH1961> that all<WH3605> the hosts<WH6635> of the LORD<WH3068> went out<WH3318> from the land<WH4480> <WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>

It <WH1931> is a night<WH3915> to be much observed<WH8107> unto the LORD<WH3068> for bringing them out<WH3318> from the land<WH4480> <WH776> of Egypt:<WH4714> this<WH2088> is that<WH1931> night<WH3915> of the LORD<WH3068> to be observed<WH8107> of all<WH3605> the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> in their generations.<WH1755>

And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto<WH413> Moses<WH4872> and Aaron,<WH175> This<WH2063> is the ordinance<WH2708> of the passover:<WH6453> There shall no<WH3808> <WH3605> stranger<WH1121> <WH5236> eat<WH398> thereof:
But every<WH3605> man's<WH376> servant<WH5650> that is bought<WH4736> for money,<WH3701> when thou hast circumcised<WH4135> him, then<WH227> shall he eat<WH398> thereof.
A foreigner<WH8453> and a hired servant<WH7916> shall not<WH3808> eat<WH398> thereof.

In one<WH259> house<WH1004> shall it be eaten;<WH398> thou shalt not<WH3808> carry forth<WH3318> aught of<WH4480> the flesh<WH1320> abroad<WH2351> out of<WH4480> the house;<WH1004> neither<WH3808> shall ye break<WH7665> a bone<WH6106> thereof.
All <WH3605> the congregation<WH5712> of Israel<WH3478> shall keep<WH6213> it.

And when<WH3588> a stranger<WH1616> shall sojourn<WH1481> with<WH854> thee, and will keep<WH6213> the passover<WH6453> to the LORD,<WH3068> let all<WH3605> his males<WH2145> be circumcised,<WH4135> and then<WH227> let him come near<WH7126> and keep<WH6213> it; and he shall be<WH1961> as one that is born in<WH249> the land:<WH776> for no uncircumcised person<WH3808> <WH3605> <WH6189> shall eat<WH398> thereof.
One <WH259> law<WH8451> shall be<WH1961> to him that is homeborn,<WH249> and unto the stranger<WH1616> that sojourneth<WH1481> among<WH8432> you.
Thus did<WH6213> all<WH3605> the children<WH1121> of Israel;<WH3478> as<WH834> the LORD<WH3068> commanded<WH6680> <WH853> Moses<WH4872> and Aaron,<WH175> so<WH3651> did<WH6213> they.

And it came to pass<WH1961> the selfsame<WH2088> <WH6106> day,<WH3117> that the LORD<WH3068> did bring<WH3318> <WH853> the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> out of the land<WH4480> <WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> by<WH5921> their armies.<WH6635>
